channel.title: 10. Artificial Intelligence on The Arkr Manual
channel.description: Recent content in 10. Artificial Intelligence on The Arkr Manual

item.title: AI vs. ML vs. DL
item.description: Definitions, the history of “Good Old Fashioned AI” (GOFAI) vs. connectionism, and the hierarchy of intelligence.

item.title: Statistics for ML
item.description:
Probability, Bayes’ Theorem, Standard Deviation, and the Normal Distribution.

Probability, Bayes’ Theorem, Standard Deviation, Distributions.

item.title: Feature Engineering
item.description:
Cleaning data, normalization, one-hot encoding, and converting raw data into vectors.

Cleaning data, normalization, one-hot encoding, vectors.

item.title: Supervised Learning
item.description:
Regression (Linear/Logistic) and Classification; the process of training on labeled data.

Regression (Linear/Logistic), Classification, Labeling data.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning
item.description:
Finding patterns in unlabeled data; Clustering (K-Means) and Dimensionality Reduction (PCA).

Clustering (K-Means), Dimensionality reduction.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Agents and environments, rewards and policies, Q-learning, policy gradients, the connection to RLHF in LLMs.

item.title: Neural Networks
item.description:
Perceptrons, weights, biases, and activation functions (ReLU, Sigmoid, Softmax).

Perceptrons, Weights, Biases, Activation Functions (ReLU, Sigmoid).

item.title: Learning Process
item.description: Loss functions, Gradient Descent, Backpropagation, and the concept of Epochs.

item.title: Computer Vision
item.description:
Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), kernels, pooling, and spatial hierarchy.

Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), kernels, pooling.

item.title: Common Terminology
item.description: Understanding Tokens, Context Windows, Model Weights/Parameters, and the difference between AI and AGI.

item.title: Inference vs. Training
item.description: The computational cost of “learning” vs. the execution of a pre-trained model.

item.title: Transformers
item.description:
The Attention Mechanism, Self-Attention, and the Encoder-Decoder architecture.

The Attention Mechanism, Self-Attention, Encoders/Decoders.

item.title: How LLMs Work
item.description: Predict-next-token logic, probability distributions, and the massive scale of pre-training.

item.title: Sampling Parameters
item.description: Tuning creativity via Temperature, Top-K, and Top-P (Nucleus) sampling.

item.title: Output Control
item.description: Managing Max Tokens, Stop Sequences, and Repetition Penalties (Frequency/Presence penalty).

item.title: Prompt Caching & Optimization
item.description: KV cache mechanics, API-level prompt caching, token budgeting, context window management, chunking strategies, cost optimization.

item.title: Model Landscape
item.description:
• Proprietary Models: OpenAI (GPT series), Google (Gemini), Anthropic (Claude), and xAI (Grok).
  • Open Source Models: Meta (Llama), Mistral, and the Hugging Face ecosystem.

item.title: Fine-tuning vs. Prompting
item.description: When to update model weights vs. when to optimize the input context.

item.title: Model Hosting & Platforms
item.description: Using Azure AI, AWS SageMaker, and local runners like Ollama.

item.title: RAG Architecture
item.description: The “Open Book” approach, grounding AI in external, private data to prevent hallucinations.

item.title: RAG Pipeline
item.description:
• Chunking: Strategies for breaking long documents into digestible pieces.
  • Embedding: Turning text into high-dimensional numerical vectors using models like Sentence Transformers.
  • Retrieval: Finding relevant context using Similarity Search (Cosine Similarity).
  • Generation: Passing retrieved context into the LLM prompt.

item.title: Vector Databases
item.description: Understanding the storage layer; comparing Chroma, Pinecone, Weaviate, FAISS, LanceDB, Qdrant, Supabase, and MongoDB Atlas.

item.title: Vector Search
item.description: Indexing embeddings and performing efficient nearest-neighbor searches at scale.

item.title: RAG Orchestration
item.description: Using frameworks like LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, and RAGFlow to build pipelines.

item.title: AI Agents
item.description: Defining autonomy, models that can use tools, reason through tasks, and pursue goals.

item.title: Agentic Reasoning
item.description: ReAct Prompting (Reason + Act), Chain of Thought (CoT), and Step-back prompting.

item.title: Building Agents
item.description: Manual implementations vs. using OpenAI Functions/Tools, Vertex AI, or the Google ADK.

item.title: Model Context Protocol (MCP)
item.description:
• Core Components: The relationship between the MCP Host, Client, Server, and the Transport Layer.
  • Development: Building servers and clients to connect LLMs to local/remote data sources and tools.

item.title: Advanced Prompting
item.description: Zero-shot vs. Few-shot prompting, Self-Consistency, and Tree of Thoughts (ToT).

item.title: Multimodal Tasks
item.description: Handling more than text, Image Generation (DALL-E), Image Understanding (Vision APIs), Video, and Audio processing.

item.title: Speech & Audio
item.description: Text-to-Speech (TTS), Speech-to-Text (STT), and the Whisper API.

item.title: Multimodal Implementation
item.description: Using LangChain and LlamaIndex for vision-integrated applications.

item.title: AI Safety & Risks
item.description:
• Security: Prompt Injection attacks and adversarial testing.
  • Reliability: Hallucinations, Prompt Debiasing, and LLM Self-Evaluation.
  • Ethics: Addressing Bias and Fairness in training data.

item.title: Safety Best Practices
item.description: Implementing the OpenAI Moderation API, adding end-user IDs in prompts, and constraining inputs/outputs to prevent jailbreaking.

item.title: LLM Evaluation & Benchmarks
item.description: Benchmark datasets (MMLU, HumanEval), custom eval frameworks, human evaluation, A/B testing for LLMs, red-teaming, RAG metrics.

item.title: Use Cases for Embeddings
item.description: Moving beyond chat, Semantic Search, Data Classification, Recommendation Systems, and Anomaly Detection.
